Package gg.w6.chesslib.util

Class PositionBuilder

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.util.PositionBuilder
public class PositionBuilder extends Object
A mutable builder class for constructing Position instances programmatically.

This class allows fine-grained control over board setup, castling rights, en passant target, active color, and move counters. It is especially useful for testing, FEN parsing, or generating custom positions in code.

If a FEN string is already available, it may be more appropriate to use Position.valueOf(String) instead.

Usage example:


 Position position = new PositionBuilder()
     .addPiece(new Rook(Color.WHITE), Coordinate.valueOf("a1"))
     .addPiece(new King(Color.WHITE), Coordinate.valueOf("e1"))
     .setToMove(Color.BLACK)
     .setFullMoves(10)
     .toPosition();

This builder is reusable and can be reset using reset().

  • Constructor Details

    • PositionBuilder

      public PositionBuilder()
      Constructs a new PositionBuilder with default starting parameters.

      Initially, all castling rights are granted, the turn is set to white, and the board is empty. Empty squares are lazily initialized during toPosition() unless filled earlier.

  • Method Details

      Returns:
      this builder instance

    • toPosition

      @NotNull public @NotNull Position toPosition()
      Finalizes and constructs an immutable Position object from the current state of the builder.

      Implementation Note: Empty squares are lazily filled on first call if not already initialized.

      Implementation Note: The return object of this method may be memoized in the future, so callers should not rely on identity equality of the returned instance.

      Returns:
      a new Position object representing the current board state

    • addPiece

      @NotNull public @NotNull PositionBuilder addPiece(@NotNull @NotNull Piece piece, @NotNull @NotNull Coordinate coordinate)
      Adds a piece to the specified coordinate on the board.

      The piece parameter is not nullable. Callers wishing to remove a piece should use removePiece(Coordinate)

      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to place
      coordinate - the coordinate to place the piece on
      Returns:
      this builder instance

    • removePiece

      @NotNull public @NotNull PositionBuilder removePiece(@NotNull @NotNull Coordinate coordinate)
      Removes a piece from the specified coordinate on the board.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to remove the piece from
      Returns:
      this builder instance

    • reset

      public PositionBuilder reset()
      Resets the builder to its default state.

      This clears the board, resets all castling rights, move counters, and en passant targets.

      Returns:
      this builder instance
